lexUnit.name: drop.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move lower, to cause to sink

sentence.text: Mortified , he dropped his arms in a gesture of defeat , and the ruined peonies fell like garden rubbish around his feet .
Nicola dropped her arms and the shirt cuffs fell over her knuckles ; it was a full size too big .
And then his hands dropped from her arms and he turned and went into his bedroom .
Paige dropped her aching arms .
He blessed himself and dropped his eyes as the hearse passed .
Pinder dropped his eyes , then raised them again appealingly .
Claudia dropped her eyes , not wishing him to read her thoughts .
She dropped her eyes to the mug , unable to face his withering scorn .
She breathed deeply , dropped her hands and stood with them folded in front of her .
I stood , swayed , dropped my hands to the steps and crawled up .
He dropped his hands from her , shrugging with mock-surrender .
Tom Horrocks dropped his head , hands at his knees , groaning and smiling up at them .
She dropped her hands to her lap .
There was certainly something different about this one , she thought dreamily , and dropped her head on his shoulder again .
Fred dropped his head and groaned .
He dropped his head into his hands .
Their eyes met and she dropped her head guiltily before managing to say , ` Do n't worry , Peter .
She dropped her head back to relieve the tension in her neck , and gazed up at the rigging .
Mr Hatton sat down for a moment and dropped his head briefly into his hands .
Her mouth dropped open .
